posts.name: Aarush saxena
posts.cooked:
@s.anand @carlton @Saransh_Saini @Jivraj

‚ÄúStudents are allowed to take help from their pets in completing assignments.‚Äù
So I did.

Confession: My Labrador Did All My Assignments

Yes, I got great marks in Assignments, ROEs, and Project 1.
But let‚Äôs be real‚Ä¶

It was my Labrador who did the actual work

While I was snoozing through deadlines, he was:

  • Solving deployment issues faster than my dev server boots
  • Writing function calling code like a true GPT whisperer
  • Fixing LLM bugs that I didn‚Äôt even understand

Meanwhile, I was just vibing in my blanket.
He growled at broken APIs.
I took the credit.

Message from the Dog Developer:

‚ÄúThank you all for an awesome semester!
I learned more than some juniors. From containerization to prompt tuning.
But I am personally offended by one thing‚Ä¶‚Äù

‚ÄúHow dare you give bonus marks on Week 7?
I skipped it ‚Äî just like many ‚Äî because we were told only best 4 of 7 would count.
I demand justice. And a belly rub.‚Äù
‚Äì , Full-stack Labrador & Part-time Therapist

Moral of the story:

Let your pets help with your coursework.
You get the grade. They get the rage.

posts.name: ABHIJEET KUMAR
posts.cooked:
After fighting so much for GA, ROE, Project 1, and Project 2, my inner animal got hurt and fell asleep ‚Äî and that‚Äôs how I ended up missing GA7. Please don‚Äôt hurt him any further.
